data.title: Food Truck-3 cheers !
data.text: I saw the truck at the Market and ordered a breakfast burrito. I can't say enough good things about Adobos--the truck was clean, the employees were nice, friendly, efficient and they served a great burrito in about 3-4 minutes.  If this burrito is a good example of their food, I'm in. Have never stopped at the Grill but I soon will.

data.title: Best ever Mexican food
data.text: We were downtown looking for a place to eat and came across this place. At first we were a little unsure as we were the only guests in the place but shortly after sitting down, about 9 other people came in.  We were not expecting the quantity of food here but I have to say that it was some of the best Mexican food that I've ever had!!

data.title: Great food, great value!
data.text: We ate there on a Tuesday night and it was not busy at all (I suppose they get more of a lunch crowd). The restaurant was very clean and nicely decorated. They have a burrito bar - for about $7, you can pick a shell (or taco salad bowl) and then go down the line like at Subway and pick and choose from all kinds of tasty things to put on there. The beef was tasty, the vegetables fresh, the salsa ranging from mild to super-spicy. This was the best taco salad I have ever had! What a deal!

data.title: Good food
data.text: Looking for Mexican food in Dubuque, we found this eatery close to our hotel (walking distance from the Hotel Julien). My wife was very impressed with her taco bowl. I enjoyed my burrito but not as much. Very similar to chipotle but with a more friendly touch.

data.title: Great Burrito Bowl
data.text: While staying in Galena we drove out to the Field of Dreams for a day trip. On the way back we wanted Mexican food. My daughter did a search on her phone and it took us here. If you like the burrito bowls from a more commonly known restaurant you will LOVE these! Salsas were good, meats were good, everything was good!

data.title: Not sure what the hype is all about!
data.text: Food was just okay. Our server seemed like he had somewhere better to be. Wasn't sure if my margarita had any tequila in it or not. We really wanted to like this place and we were very disappointed after reading the five star reviews. We've had much better Mexican.

data.title: Best Nachos!
data.text: Nacho or Burrito bar with all the fixings, they also have a full menu if you wish.  Plenty of seating, very popular place.

data.title: Best in town!
data.text: Great burrito and taco bar . Fast friendly service at food price. Highly recommended for going alone with friends or with family it's great whichever way! Good for lunch and dinner!

data.title: The salsa is 2 bucks!
data.text: Which I guess, isn't bad if you only want chips and salsa. But, if you order chips and guacamole, ($3.50, btw,) and you want salsa, it's $2 more, because that's the price if chips and salsa. I usually see salsa as a condiment provided at the table with a small dish, dispense as needed. I really didn't need the amount that I got, I just wanted a little to go with the guacamole. So my chips, guacamole, and soda were $8. It was all good, but I get better salsa from Azteca in Davenport, it is on the table, and I get a waitstaff. Maybe I'm being cranky, but it seemed a bit ridiculous since with one dollar more I could have bought a loaded burrito or nachos. The moral of the story: order nachos.

data.title: Best Mexican in Dubuque
data.text: I haven't been to Dubuque in years and while visiting, my friends took me to Adobos Mexican Grill. The food was very delicious and fresh. I would recommend the taco salad. It was hard to hear the workers behind the counter asking what foods to put on my salad.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: My boyfriend and I stopped here for lunch one day to check out what the buzz was all about. We were definitely not disappointed! It was delicious!!!

data.title: Nice surprise
data.text: Needed a lunch place. Food good. Poor water was doing it all bartending, waiting tables and cleaning, but the customers we  not neglected. He was great.

data.title: Great, Local Mexican Food
data.text:
Adobos is set up like Pancheros or Chipotle, but has a larger variety of fresh ingredients, is locally owned and tastes fantastic!

If you can't get their restaurant on Main St., they have a tent at the Farmers Market every Saturday serving breakfast burritos to die for!  Get there early as the line gets long quick!

data.title: Will be going back!
data.text:
Our family of six ate here last weekend - and will be going back!  The food was tasty, the place was clean, and it had a casual yet fun environment.  I ate a carnitas bowl (as I tend to eat paleo type dishes) while the rest of the crew had steak burritos.  The portions were generous...my four kids (ages 5-11) split two burritos amongst themselves and we brought leftovers home.  Most of the dishes were around $7 each.  Each of the burritos were served with a handful of tortilla chips.  The kids loved having a jarritos soda with their dish and I had a fountain soda.

Very tasty...we'll be back!

data.title: Great people!
data.text: I love that the owner remembers my order each time I come in. Friendly service and yummy food.  The only issue is parking during weekdays lunch rush.

data.title: Great fast casual Mexican
data.text:
I've been here about ten times now for their burrito bowl.  This is as close as we'll get to Chipotle in Dubuque.  Same setup where you tell them what ingredients that you would like on your burrito, bowl, nachos, etc. 

The service is fast and friendly, and they offer great margaritas.  I believe they also off wait service for dinner.

I will be back a lot.

data.title: Dang son!
data.text: Great burritos - more authentic than you'd get at Pancheros/other chains.  Flavorful food - lots of salsa options.  My favorite spot for take-out.

data.title: 9.5 out of 10
data.text: I ate the sit down menu here at Adobos a while back, and while it was good, the new burrito bar takes it over the top. Similar to its fellow fast casual burrito bars Chipotle and Pancheros, Adobos has you choose and build various Mexican dishes. Adobos stands out from these other burrito bars however by being much more authentic. So essentially, it is a local and more authentic version of Pancheros. I probably like Pancheros a bit better taste-wise, however you get much more food for your buck at Adobos and the authenticity is nice. Fast, good, and well priced, Adobos is a must in Dubuque.

data.title: Out of this world breakfast burrito
data.text: Adobos Mexican Grill has a food stand on Saturdays at the Farmer's Market in Dubuque (not at the actual restaurant). It is located between Iowa and Main Street on 12th.  Their breakfast burritos or you can choose their breakfast bowl is the biggest and best breakfast burrito I've eaten.  Be careful, if you are a light eater, one will feed two!  They're that big.  There can be a line (that is how good they are), but they are quick to make them up, cook, and serve to you within a few minutes of ordering.  When they run out of ingredients, they're done, so I would get there by 9:00 a.m.  Really the best breakfast burrito I've eaten.

data.title: Best Burritos you can find.
data.text:
The best way to describe Adobos is by comparing it to Chipotle or Pancheros. It is a burrito bar style restaurant, but much better than any chain place you have ever been to. All of the ingredients are fresh, with marinated chicken, beef or two kinds of pork. There are more options than the chain restaurants, and the burritos are much bigger! 

The restaurant also offers, tacos, salads, burrito bowls, etc, with a good range of drink options as well (including alcohol). 

I highly recommend this place for an affordable, filling and delicious meal.
